parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Effects in MP</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Attach a statement to a unit. The statement is propagated over the network in MP games, it can be executed by invoking [[processInitCommands]].

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3</title><part><name index="1"/><value>For security reasons, the command was disabled in Arma 3. Use [[remoteExec]] for remote execution.</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unitName [[setVehicleInit]] statement </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> statement: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>Return value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldier3 [[setVehicleInit]] "[[this]] [[allowFleeing]] 0";</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[Multiplayer Scripting]], [[Initialization Order]], [[processInitCommands]], [[clearVehicleInit]] </value></part><part><name>See also</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> The statement will be sent to clients connecting after the command has been executed.<br>
Note that the statement will be executed automatically by [[JIP]] clients before [[Init.sqs]] or its [[SQF]] counterpart has been executed. </value></part><part><name/>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">03:12, 20 March 2008 (CET)
<dt class="note">[[User:Crowe|Crowe]]
<dd class="note">setVehicleInit statements will be executed in the order of the unit creation time.
This means, the statements of units who have been placed in the editor first, will be executed first.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 22, 2016 - 21:38 (UTC)
<dt class="note">[[User:AgentRevolution|AgentRev]]
<dd class="note">
[[remoteExec]] and [[remoteExecCall]] will accept an object as JIP parameter, which make them behave in a very similar way to [[setVehicleInit]] before it was disabled.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
